Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.game.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameModelInterface
public class Game extends Object implements GameModelInterface
This class is used to handle the main logic of a Game

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Game(int numPlayers, Player host)
    Constructor of the Game objects, it initializes all the attributes, set stdPointsReference, draw the CommonGoalCard, add the host to the game and assign to him a PersonalGoalCard

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(int numPlayers, Player host) throws NegativeFieldException, PlayersNumberOutOfRange, NotEnoughCardsException, IllegalFilePathException
      Constructor of the Game objects, it initializes all the attributes, set stdPointsReference, draw the CommonGoalCard, add the host to the game and assign to him a PersonalGoalCard
      Parameters:
      numPlayers - is the total number of the players for the game, the initialization of the board changes based on this
      host - is the Player that have created the game
      Throws:
      NegativeFieldException - if the number of cards to draw is negative
      PlayersNumberOutOfRange - if the numPlayers is less than 2 or more than 4
      NotEnoughCardsException - if the cards to be drawn are more than the number of cards loaded with the JSON file configuration
      IllegalFilePathException - if the configuration file path is invalid

    • canStart

      check if the game can start
      Specified by:
      canStart in interface GameModelInterface
      Returns:

    • start

      public void start() throws NotAllPlayersHaveJoinedException, GameNotEndedException
      This method is used to start the game, it chooses randomly a starting player
      Specified by:
      start in interface GameModelInterface
      Throws:
      NotAllPlayersHaveJoinedException - if the number of player that have joined is less than the number set when the game was created
      GameNotEndedException - if the game has already started

    • updatePlayerPoints

      public void updatePlayerPoints(String username) throws InvalidPlayerException, NotEnoughSpaceException, GameNotStartedException
      This method is used to update the points of the player passed as argument
      Specified by:
      updatePlayerPoints in interface GameModelInterface
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player whose points you wish to update
      Throws:
      InvalidPlayerException - if there isn't a player with that username inside the game
      NotEnoughSpaceException - if there was an error with the CommonGoalCard
      GameNotStartedException - if the game is not started yet

    • getPlayerInTurn

      public String getPlayerInTurn() throws GameEndedException, GameNotStartedException
      gets the player that is in the turn
      Specified by:
      getPlayerInTurn in interface GameModelInterface
      Returns:
      a String representing the name of the player
      Throws:
      GameEndedException - if the game is ended
      GameNotStartedException - if the game has not started yet

    • moveTiles

      public void moveTiles(ArrayList<Coordinates> source, int column) throws InvalidCoordinatesException, EmptySlotException, NotEnoughSpaceException, GameNotStartedException
      make it possible to move tiles from the livingRoomBoard to a column of the current player in turn
      Specified by:
      moveTiles in interface GameModelInterface
      Parameters:
      source - the source coordinates
      column - the column chosen by the player
      Throws:
      InvalidCoordinatesException - if the coordinates chosen don't follow the constraints
      EmptySlotException - if one of the coordinate is empty
      NotEnoughSpaceException - it the column has no enough space left
      GameNotStartedException - if the game has not started yet

    • checkValidRetrieve

      public boolean checkValidRetrieve(ArrayList<Coordinates> coords) throws EmptySlotException, GameNotStartedException
      checks if the item tiles in a certain coordinate can be chosen by the player
      Specified by:
      checkValidRetrieve in interface GameModelInterface
      Parameters:
      coords - the coordinates in the livingroomboard containing the interested tiles
      Returns:
      true, if is possible to get that tiles, false otherwise
      Throws:
      EmptySlotException - if one of the coordinates referes to an empty slot
      GameNotStartedException - if the game hasn't started yet

      newPlayer - the Player to be inserted
      Throws:
      NicknameAlreadyUsedException - if the nickname of the player have been already chosen
      PlayersNumberOutOfRange - if the game have reached the maximum number of players

    • getPlayerMessages

      public ArrayList<Message> getPlayerMessages(String player) throws InvalidPlayerException
      This is the method to retrieve all the messages relative to a player, either sent and received
      Specified by:
      getPlayerMessages in interface GameModelInterface
      Parameters:
      player - a String that represent the username of the player for which to search the messages
      Returns:
      an Arraylist of messages relative to the player
      Throws:
      InvalidPlayerException - if there isn't a player with that username inside the game

    • postMessage

      public void postMessage(String sender, String receiver, String message) throws SenderEqualsRecipientException, InvalidPlayerException
      This method is used to send a private message to another user
      Specified by:
      postMessage in interface GameModelInterface
      Parameters:
      sender - is the username of the sender
      receiver - is the username of the receiver
      message - is the message object that will be added to the list
      Throws:
      SenderEqualsRecipientException - if the recipient and the sender of the message is the same user
      InvalidPlayerException - if there isn't a player with that username inside the game

    • triggerAllListeners

      public void triggerAllListeners(String userToBeUpdated)
      Method used to trigger all the listeners when a player joins or re-joins a game after a crash, to receive the complete status of the game such as players bookshelf's, points or livingRoomBoard
      Specified by:
      triggerAllListeners in interface GameModelInterface
      Parameters:
      userToBeUpdated - the username of the user that needs to receive the updates
